oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Sculpture; Mansions; Estates
Monuments; Soldiers; Gallatin (Tenn.); United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Granite and bronze monument features sculpture of Confederate soldier. A view of Trousdale Place and its estate grounds is visible behind the monument.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee Civil War Centennial Commission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Gallatin Confederate Monument was dedicated on September 19, 1903. The Clark Chapter of the Daughters of the Confederacy erected the monument on the lawn of the Trousdale Mansion. Governor William Trousdale's dauther-in-law, Annie Berry Trousdale, had deeded the home to the Clark Chapter in 1899.
